alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Mendocino Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 13 at 10:11AM PST until January 14 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in California... Russian River near Hopland affecting Southeastern Mendocino Interior zone. For the Russian River...including Hopland...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. A peak stage of about 16 feet is forecast for the Russian River at Hopland. * WHERE...Russian River near Hopland. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding of Highway 175 is expected at the approaches to the Russian River bridge. Expect flooding of cropland on the right bank of river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM PST Saturday the stage was 3.4 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached this evening as soon as 7 PM local time. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/eka. The next statement will be issued this evening at 615 PM PST.
